article.Heading: Macro Eco Survey 2016: FY17 inflation seen at 4.5-5%, India's exports to recover
article.Summary: A spike in oil prices may drag consumption and hurt monetary easing prospects, the survey says, adding exports slow down may continue for a while before picking up in FY17.
article.Body:
The government sees the consumer price inflation (CPI) in the range of 4.5-5 percent, as per the Macro-Economic Survey for 2015-16 tabled in the Parliament by Finance Minister Arun Jaitley on Friday.

The risk to higher inflation arises if wage hikes spill to the private sector, it says.

As per the survey presented by the Chief Economic Advisor, the impact of global volatilities on India is likely to be less than other emerging economies. However, growth could face considerable headwinds if global demand remains weak.

A spike in oil prices may drag consumption and hurt monetary easing prospects, the survey says, adding exports slow down may continue for a while before picking up in FY17.

On the current stress faced by the domestic banking sector, the survey says underlying stressed assets in corporate sector must be sold or rehabilitated.

Accordingly, certain non-financial assets could be sold off to recapitalise public sector banks. Earlier, the minister of state for finance Jayant Sinha had said power has been given to banks to recover money from debt-ridden promoters.
